original: Björkander, Carl Gustaf, vice konsul, grosshandlare, Visby, f. 6/6/84 i Visby av v. konsul C. J. B. o. Henrietta Wallér. G. 10 m. Märta BoHn. Barn: Maj f. 12, Ivar 16, disp. i A-B C. J. Björkander & Son. — Mogiex. i Visby 03, fackkurs v. Gbgs hand:-inst. 03-04. Vohanst. i Bremen 04-05, i faderns firma i Visby 05, deläg. i denna, ombild. t. A-B C. J. Björkander & Son 09, föret, verkst. dir. sed. 12 o. ensam styr:led. sed. 18. Rysk konsularag. 08, rysk v. konsul 12-16, britt. v. konsul sed. 22. V. ordf. i hamndir. sed. 23, i drätselkamm. 32-31, ordf. i hand:- o. sjöf :ndn, led. av stadsfullm. sed. 28, dess v. ordf., landstingsman (h) sed. 35, ordf. i Gotl. hand :kamm., Köpm :gillet i Visby, Visby grossistfören., ordf. i styr. f. Ångfartygs A-B Gotland, A-B Visby Stadshotell, A-B Snäckgärdsbaden, A-B Visby Motorcentral, Visby Stuveri A-B, v. ordf. i styr. f. A-B Gotlands Bank, led. av styr. f. De badande vännernas sparbank, KAK Hotell A-B, ordf. i De badande vännernas trädgårdssityrelse, v. ordf. i Gotl. fornvänner, Sällsk. f. gotl. forskn., Gotl. turistfören., led. av styr. f. Sv. foderämnes- o. spannmålsimp. fören. Föret. res. t. Norge, Danm., Finl., Engl., Frankr. o. Mellan- o. Sydeuropa. Hobbies: trädg :skötsel, fornm:- o. naturskyddsvård. RNO, RVO, KAK förtj:GM, FAK förtj :t., KorrespLHA.
translated: Björkander, Carl Gustaf, vice consul, merchant, Visby, b. 6/6/84 in Visby to Vice consul CJ B. and Henrietta Wallér. Married to Märta BoHn in 1910. Children: Maj b. 1912, Ivar b. 1916, employee at AB CJ Björkander & Son. Started his own business in Visby in 1903 and completed a vocational course at Gothenburg's School of Business in 1903-04. Worked in Bremen in 1904-05 and then joined his father's company in Visby in 1905. Became a partner in this business in 1909 and restructured it into AB CJ Björkander & Son. Became a managing director in 1912 and the sole managing director from 1918 onwards. Appointed as Russian Consul General in 1908, served as Russian Vice Consul from 1912 to 1916 and British Vice Consul from 1922. Vice-chairman of the Harbour Board from 1923 and a member of the City Council from 1928, serving as deputy chairman. County council member for the conservative party from 1935. Chairman of the Gotland Chamber of Commerce, the Visby Wholesalers Association, and the Board of Steamship AB Gotland. Vice-chairman of the Board of Directors for AB Gotlands Bank. Member of the Board of Directors for the De badande vännernas savings bank and KAK Hotel AB. Chairman of the Board of Directors for the De badande vännernas garden committee, vice-chairman of the Gotland Antiquarian Society, the Society for Gotland Research, and the Gotland Tourist Association. Member of the Board of Directors for the Swedish feed and grain importers association. Business trips to Norway, Denmark, Finland, England, France, and Central and Southern Europe. Hobbies: gardening, antiquities, and nature conservation. Recipient of the Royal Order of Vasa, the Royal Order of the Polar Star, the Illis Quorum by KAK, and honorary doctorate by the Faculty of Economics at Stockholm University. Corresponding member of the Swedish Academy of Letters, History and Antiquities.

structured.description: Swedish merchant and Vice Consul. Born in Visby on June 6, 1884, the son of Vice Consul CJ B. Björkander and Henrietta Wallér. Married Märta BoHn in 1910 and they had two children, Maj and Ivar. He completed a vocational course at Gothenburg's School of Business in 1903-04 and worked in Bremen in 1904-05. He joined his father's company in Visby in 1905, became a partner in 1909, and restructured it into AB CJ Björkander & Son. From 1912 onwards, he was the managing director of the firm. Björkander served as the Russian Consul General from 1908 and then as the Russian Vice Consul from 1912 to 1916. He was appointed as the British Vice Consul in 1922. Björkander was an active member of the Visby community and served as a member of City Council, Vice-chairman of the Harbour Board, and a County council member for the conservative party. Björkander passed away on September 19, 1958.
